headline.main: In Salvador, They Are Still Fleeing the Violence; A Nicaragua Strategy

docs.snippet: LEAD: A double-barreled reality leaps out of the Central American peace process: the Reagan Administration doesn't want peace, and the Sandinistas say they do but are unwilling to pay the necessary price for it....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A double-barreled reality leaps out of the Central American peace process: the Reagan Administration doesn't want peace, and the Sandinistas say they do but are unwilling to pay the necessary price for it.

docs.snippet: LEAD: With less than a week until Central American Presidents meet to assess five months of progress toward regional peace, three of the four Nicaraguans appointed to monitor the compliance of the Sandinista Government with the new peace accord sa...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: With less than a week until Central American Presidents meet to assess five months of progress toward regional peace, three of the four Nicaraguans appointed to monitor the compliance of the Sandinista Government with the new peace accord say it has not met its obligations.

byline.original: By STEPHEN KINZER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: IT WAS MIDDAY AND THE President of Costa Rica was hungry. Pausing just long enough to invite a visitor along, he hopped in his blue Honda Accord and drove to a nearby corner restaurant. The President brought along his sunglasses but left his...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IT WAS MIDDAY AND THE President of Costa Rica was hungry. Pausing just long enough to invite a visitor along, he hopped in his blue Honda Accord and drove to a nearby corner restaurant. The President brought along his sunglasses but left his bodyguards behind.

byline.original: By James LeMoyne; James LeMoyne is the Times's bureau chief in San Salvador

docs.snippet: LEAD: FOR ONE REASON AND AN-other, some great performers don't fit easily onto the motion picture screen. The camera wasn't kind to the Lunts in ''The Guardsman'' (1931), their first (and last) co-starring screen appearance. Somewhere between the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: FOR ONE REASON AND AN-other, some great performers don't fit easily onto the motion picture screen. The camera wasn't kind to the Lunts in ''The Guardsman'' (1931), their first (and last) co-starring screen appearance. Somewhere between the movie set and the movie theater, the grace and elegant humor that were evident in all of their theatrical performances evaporated.

headline.main: Big Talents vs. the Big Screen

docs.snippet: LEAD: ALTHOUGH the state's professional theaters reflect a repertory of extraordinary variety - from the new year's first opening (a Shakespearean tragedy, as interpreted by a leading and much-lauded experimental troupe) to the season's windup (th...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ALTHOUGH the state's professional theaters reflect a repertory of extraordinary variety - from the new year's first opening (a Shakespearean tragedy, as interpreted by a leading and much-lauded experimental troupe) to the season's windup (the reworking of a failed, but, for many, a favorite Jerry Herman musical) - it appears that the current attention-getters are three artistic directors.

docs.snippet: LEAD: MICHAEL J. FOX HAS BEEN dragged by the collar, thrashing and yelling, down the length of a fashion-show runway and tossed out the door several times. Now, resting between takes on the set of ''Bright Lights, Big City,'' he's sitting in the s...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MICHAEL J. FOX HAS BEEN dragged by the collar, thrashing and yelling, down the length of a fashion-show runway and tossed out the door several times. Now, resting between takes on the set of ''Bright Lights, Big City,'' he's sitting in the second-floor foyer of the Parsons School of Design in Manhattan, joking with his real-life bodyguard, who plays the fashion-show bouncer on screen, and talking to Jay McInerney.

byline.original: Caryn James; Caryn James is a reporter for the culture desk of The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: THIS is the time of year when northern grandmasters peruse travel folders of balmier climes in the effort to align comfort with a reasonable competition to play in. Since sponsors pick up air tickets and, indeed, the entire stay, it does not...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THIS is the time of year when northern grandmasters peruse travel folders of balmier climes in the effort to align comfort with a reasonable competition to play in. Since sponsors pick up air tickets and, indeed, the entire stay, it does not matter how long the journey may be.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The prospects for peace in Central America appear bleak as the region's leaders prepare to meet next week to judge the results of the peace plan they signed five months ago....
